name: DV_TEXT
title: DV_TEXT
description: A text item, which may contain any amount of legal characters arranged as e.g. words, sentences etc (i.e. one DV_TEXT may be more than one word). Visual formatting and hyperlinks may be included via markdown.

element.short: Items which are truly boolean data
element.definition: Type for representing identifiers of real-world entities. Typical identifiers include drivers licence number, social security number, veterans affairs number, prescription id, order id, and so on. DV_TEXT is used to represent any identifier of a real thing, issued by some authority or agency.

element.short: Displayable rendition of the item, regardless of its underlying structure
element.definition: Displayable rendition of the item, regardless of its underlying structure. For DV_CODED_TEXT, this is the rubric of the complete term as provided by the terminology service.

element.short: DEPRECATED: this field is deprecated; use markdown
element.definition: DEPRECATED: this field is deprecated; use markdown link/text in the value attribute, and 'markdown' as the value of the formatting field.
element.comment: Original usage, prior to RM Release 1.0.4: Optional link sitting behind a section of plain text or coded term item.

element.short: Terms from other terminologies most closely matching this term
element.definition: Terms from other terminologies most closely matching this term, typically used where the originator (e.g. pathology lab) of information uses a local terminology but also supplies one or more equivalents from well known terminologies (e.g. LOINC).

element.short: Optional indicator of the localised language in which the value is written
element.definition: Optional indicator of the localised language in which the value is written. Coded from openEHR Code Set languages . Only used when either the text object is in a different language from the enclosing ENTRY, or else the text object is being used outside of an ENTRY or other enclosing structure which indicates the language.

element.short: Name of character encoding scheme in which this value is encoded
element.definition: Name of character encoding scheme in which this value is encoded. Coded from openEHR Code Set character sets . Unicode is the default assumption in openEHR, with UTF-8 being the assumed encoding. This attribute allows for variations from these assumptions.
